intro: Gilia multicaulis var. stricta, commonly known as the stiffstalk gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of showy, pink to purple flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a fuzzy texture. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
